content.description: Dylan recently quit his job as a journalist for a local newspaper where he was making $80,000 per year. He opened an ice-cream shop where he earns a yearly total revenue of $250,000. He spends $150,000 each year on rent, resources, and workers he hires. Which of the following equals Dylanâ€™s accounting profit and economic profit from the ice-cream shop?
content.question: Accounting ProfitEconomic ProfitA$250,000$20,000B$230,000$100,000C$150,000$70,000D$100,000$80,000E$100,000$20,000

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Determine the effect(s) of a change in an economic situation using quantitative data or calculations.
